basics.name: Pocholo Arangote
basics.label: Aspiring Cyber-Security Professional
basics.summary: With extensive experience mentoring and coaching students of all ages as a Swim Instructor and Volunteer, I communicate effectively with both non technical and technical people. As a formerly trained lifeguard, I am trained to have good attention to detail. With strong communication skills, attention to detail, and my studies in Information Systems Security, I bring a customer-focused approach to the analysis and protection of clients' systems.

work.summary:
- Improved customer satisfaction by providing high quality swimming education to classes of up to 10 people.
- Ensured safety of staff and customers by supervising multiple swimmers of various age groups, and being inclusive to any disabilities.
- Assisted with basic pool maintenance to ensure a safe, orderly working environment. 
- Provided Parent/Guardian with detailed report on student success.

volunteer.summary:
- Increased effectiveness of swim instruction by assisting instructor with class and performing demonstrations.
- Mentored weakest students one-on-one to help bring them up to class level, and hopefully pass the course.
- Performed basic pool cleanliness procedures, and ensured compliance with rules

courses: INFO 16529 - Security Threats and Risk Assessment
INFO 39207 - Advanced Information Systems Forensics and Electronic Discovery
TELE 30004 - Network and Distributed Systems Security

awards.title: ISSessions CTF 2021 11th Place
awards.summary: Packet Analysis with Wireshark, Digital Forensics with Autopsy, MITRE ATT&CK Framework, OSINT
